ext_descriptions.ext_description: A printed_part_template_terminal_class lists the classes of the printed part template terminal.
specifies the type of the printed part template terminal to be curve edge segment;
specifies the type of the printed part template terminal to be surface point;
specifies the type of the printed part template terminal to be an area edge segment;
specifies the type of the printed part template terminal to be a surface area;
A Non_conductive_cross_section_template is a type of .
specifies a for the Non_conductive_cross_section_template.
specifies a for the Non_conductive_cross_section_template. There shall be one or more for a template_technology. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: A Printed_connector_template is a type of a . A Printed_connector_template is a that contains contacts, each of whose function is to act as a short from an to the related . Each contact corresponds to one member of characterized_connector_terminal_relationship. The contact shall be a and the geometric relationship of the shape of the contact to the shape of the Printed_connector_template shall be established by a member of .

example.p: Figure 1 illustrates a template and associated parameters for one contact of a printed connector. Specific parameter values and explicit geometry will be provided for individual technology based contacts.
Figure 2 illustrates a detail of a layout drawing that shows an instance of the Printed_connector_template.

figure.title: Printed connector component and associated terminals

ext_description.note: It is redundant to have a separate functional definition that merely specifies shorts for any type of connector in this part of ISO 10303, because the functional definition of a short is included in the definition of the connector. That is, a functional definition that worries about shorts is not a functional definition. It is appropriate to define the location of required shorts in the physical definition, and connector is one of the places in this part of ISO 10303 where that occurs.

There may be multiple simulation models associated with a connector in this part of ISO 10303. The explicit method of defining the connector functionality does not prohibit having multiple simulation models. This explicit method is for the purpose of supporting the standardized structural definition of connectivity.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Printed_connector_template is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Printed_connector_template as its . There shall be one or more for a Printed_connector_template.

ext_description.p: A Printed_connector_template_terminal_relationship is the definition of the connection between a and a for one contact of a .
ext_description.note: An occurrence of Printed_connector_template_terminal_relationship is only required at the model level in the Standard. A that references a has the visibility of this functional requirement by virtue of a mandatory inverse relationship to the Printed_connector_template_terminal_relationship on the .
A Printed_connector_template_terminal_relationship is the actual specification of the short referred to in .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the role of the for the Printed_connector_template_terminal_relationship.
specifies the role of the for the Printed_connector_template_terminal_relationship.
specifies the role of the for the Printed_connector_template_terminal_relationship.
The combination of the join_terminal and the connector shall be unique within a population of Printed_connector_template_terminal_relationships.
The combination of the interface_terminal and the connector shall be unique within a population of Printed_connector_template_terminal_relationships.

ext_description.p: A Printed_part_cross_section_template is a type of that describes a cross sectional view of a .

example.p: Figure 3 illustrates parameters, cross-sectional geometry, and materials needed to describe different transmission lines and related media.

Figure 4 illustrates the cross-section view related to a . The parameters included in the illustration are included in the for the associated and will be assigned specific values through and associated application objects.

specifies the role of the for the Printed_part_cross_section_template.
specifies the role of the for the Printed_part_cross_section_template.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the minimum overall lateral dimension through all the material of the Printed_part_cross_section_template.
specifies the maximum overall lateral dimension through all the material of the Printed_part_cross_section_template.

ext_description.p: specifies the role of the for the Printed_part_cross_section_template. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the role of the for the Printed_part_cross_section_template. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the role of the for the Printed_part_cross_section_template.

ext_description.p: specifies a role of the for the Printed_part_cross_section_template. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies a role of the for the Printed_part_cross_section_template. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: Each horizontal link shall have a right boundary.
Each horizontal link shall have a left boundary.
Each vertical link shall have a bottom boundary.
Each vertical link shall have a top boundary.
The horizontal_material_link shall not be the vertical_material_link.
The start_vertex shall not be the end_vertex.

ext_description.p: A Printed_part_cross_section_template_terminal is a type of that is the terminal of the .
specifies a role of the for the Printed_part_cross_section_template_terminal. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies a role of the for the Printed_part_cross_section_template_terminal. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies a role of the for the Printed_part_cross_section_template_terminal. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies a role of the for the Printed_part_cross_section_template_terminal. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the role of the for the Printed_part_cross_section_template_terminal.

the cross_section_definition, material_to_left_of_terminal, material_to_right_of_terminal, material_to_top_of_terminal, and material_to_bottom_of_terminal shall be unique within a population of the Printed_part_cross_section_template_terminal.
The inherited from shall be or .

ext_description.p: material_to_left_of_terminal shall not be material_to_right_of_terminal.
material_to_left_of_terminal shall not be material_to_top_of_terminal.
material_to_left_of_terminal shall not be material_to_bottom_of_terminal.
material_to_right_of_terminal shall not be material_to_top_of_terminal.
material_to_right_of_terminal shall not be material_to_bottom_of_terminal.
material_to_top_of_terminal shall not be material_to_bottom_of_terminal.

A Printed_part_template is a type of . Each Printed_part_template may be either one of or both of a or a . a Printed_part_template is a that has a specified function. Material may be discontiguous in a Printed_part_template.
ext_description.note: An occurrence of this object is a that is realized during the manufacturing process for the printed circuit board.
The functionality realized in an occurrence of a Printed part is determined by the shape of the occurrence and the material constituting the occurrence.

example.p: Figure 5 illustrates shape data associated with single layer printed part. This part of ISO 10303 supports complex, specific purpose, multi-layer printed part exchange using the design reuse concept with the being a design view that contains the full multi-layer definition of the part design. Individual elements of the part design on a layer basis would be related to individual elements in the design being created using the .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the role of the for the Printed_part_template. The raw_access_mechanisms may be an empty set for a particular Printed_part_template. The raw_access_mechanisms provide direct access to the member of Printed_part_template without the need to traverse sub templates of the template.
an attribute an attribute is an inverse of footprint_implementation.
an attribute evaluates to TRUE only if printed_part_template_stack is not provided.
an attribute evaluates to TRUE only if material_stack is not provided.
an attribute evaluates to TRUE only if of_stratum_technology is not provided.
an attribute evaluates to TRUE only if this Printed_part_template is refered by as .

an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Printed_part_template is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Printed_part_template as its . There shall be two or more for a Printed_part_template.
specifies the role of the for the Printed_part_template. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies the role of the for the Printed_part_template. The printed_part_template_stack specifies a vertical sequence of Printed_part_template. The members of the sequence may themselves contain terminals. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies the role of the for the Printed_part_template. The material_stack is a simple vertical structure where the complexity of the printed_part_template_stack is unwarranted. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: specifies the role of for the Printed_part_template. The intent of having more than one available is that the same template may be used for various technologies. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.note: The set of technologies has nothing to do with vertical stackup.
ext_description.example: The same template might support varying copper thickness, each variation requiring a specific , since thickness is a key characteristic of .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: No more than one of of_stratum_technology, material_stack, printed_part_template_stack, footprint_implementation shall exist for a member of Printed_part_template.
The category associated with a member of Printed_part_template shall be 'printed part' unless the Printed_part_template is a .
No more than one shall reference a member of Printed_part_template.
The function this member of Printed_part_template implements shall be the associated function for the functional terminals mapped to the terminals of this member of Printed_part_template.
The Printed_part_template will have two product categories populated: one for the and one for the Printed_part_template. There is no conflict between these two categories.
A Printed_part_template_connected_terminals_definition is the association between two or more that are connected.
the words by which the Printed_part_template_connected_terminals_definition is known.

specifies the for the Printed_part_template_connected_terminals_definition. There shall be two or more
for the Printed_part_template_connected_terminals_definition.
The name shall be unique within a population of Printed_part_template_connected_terminals_definitions.

ext_description.p: A Printed_part_template_interface_terminal is a type of , an occurrence of which is an external access to the printed circuit board of which it is a component.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: an inverse relationship that specifies the that specifies the Printed_part_template_interface_terminal as its . There shall be one or more for a Printed_part_template_interface_terminal.

ext_description.p: specifies a role of the for the Printed_part_template_interface_terminal.
A Printed_part_template_join_terminal is a type of an occurrence of which provides access to the functionality of the from within a printed circuit board.
ext_description.note: Join is a concept that explicitly states the purpose is for completing the network connections internal to a physical design.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: an inverse relationship that specifies the that specifies the Printed_part_template_join_terminal as its . There shall be no more than one for a Printed_part_template_join_terminal.

an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Printed_part_template_link is dependent on the existence of the .
specifies a role of the for the Printed_part_template_link.
specifies a role of the for the Printed_part_template_link.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The of precedent_printed_part_template shall exist.
The of subsequent_printed_part_template shall exist.
The of precedent_printed_part_template shall be inherited from .
The of subsequent_printed_part_template shall be inherited from .
The size of of precedent_printed_part_template shall be one.
The size of of subsequent_printed_part_template shall be one.

ext_description.p: A Printed_part_template_material is the characterized in , for the realization of the containing part of the during fabrication of the .
ext_description.note: A may span more than one , as defined by the .

ext_description.p: an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Printed_part_template_material is dependent on the existence of the .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the role of the for the Printed_part_template_material.
specifies the minimum for the width of the Printed_part_template_material. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the maximum for the width of the Printed_part_template_material. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
There shall be no more than one refering Printed_part_template_material as and having set to 'top'.
There shall be no more than one refering Printed_part_template_material as and having set to 'bottom'.
There shall be no more than one refering Printed_part_template_material as and having set to 'left'.
There shall be no more than one refering Printed_part_template_material as and having set to 'right'.

A Printed_part_template_material_link is a link that establishes an adjacency relationship between two material boundaries in the cross section view of a template. The link is directed, and helps to compose an unambiguous boundary element based definition of a cross section.
specifies a for the Printed_part_template_material_link.
specifies a for the Printed_part_template_material_link.
The precedent_material shall not be the subsequent_material.
The name attribute inherited from for the precedent_material shall be one of "bottom" or "right".
The name attribute inherited from for the subsequent_material shall be one "top" or "left".
The combination of precedent_material and subsequent_material shall be unique within a population of Printed_part_template_material_link.
A Printed_part_template_terminal is a type of . A Printed_part_template_terminal is a or additionally one of a or a . A Printed_part_template_terminal is a terminal of a .
specifies the role of the for the Printed_part_template_terminal. There shall be one or more feature_shape occurrence for the Printed_part_template_terminal.
an inverse relationship that specifies the that specifies the Printed_part_template_terminal as its . There shall be no more than one for a Printed_part_template_terminal.

an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Printed_part_template_terminal is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Printed_part_template_terminal as its . There shall be no more than one for a Printed_part_template_terminal.
an attribute inherited from identifies the descriptive label for the Printed_part_template_terminal.

specifies the role of the for the Printed_part_template_terminal. There may be one or more for a Printed_part_template_terminal. The value of this attribute need not be specified. If the source system contains the data, then the terminal_connection_zone shall be provided.
specifies either an area_edge_segment, a curve_edge_segment, a surface_area, or a surface_point for the Printed_part_template_terminal.
specifies the role of the for the Printed_part_template_terminal.
The combination of the name inherited from and the associated_definition shall be unique within a population of Printed_part_template_terminals.

ext_description.p: A Functional_usage_view_to_printed_part_template_terminal_assignment is the association between a functional terminal definition and a terminal of a .
ext_description.example: It is permissible for one functional_usage_view_terminal to be assigned to more than one physical_usage_view_terminal, for example, VCC.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the role of the for the Functional_usage_view_to_printed_part_template_terminal_assignment.
specifies the role of the for the Functional_usage_view_to_printed_part_template_terminal_assignment.
The combination of functional_usage_view_terminal and physical_usage_view_terminal shall be unique within a population of Functional_usage_view_to_printed_part_template_terminal_assignment.
A Printed_part_template_terminal_relationship is an association between two in a .
an instance specifies the independent in the Printed_part_template_terminal_relationship.
an instance specifies the dependent in the Printed_part_template_terminal_relationship.
A Template_material_cross_section_boundary is a type of .
specifies a for the Template_material_cross_section_boundary.
The name attribute inherited from shall be one of "top", "bottom", "left", or "right".
The combination of associated_definition and the name attribute inherited from shall be unique within a population of Template_material_cross_section_boundary.

The printed_part_template_access_mechanisms function returns the set of Printed_part_template_terminals composed of of precedent_printed_part_templates and subsequent_printed_part_templates of Printed_part_template_links specified by the input.
the specified set of Printed_part_template_links.
